A function between topological spaces is locally constant if the preimage of any set is open.

type: {X : Type u_1} → {Y : Type u_2} → [inst : TopologicalSpace X] → (X → Y) → Prop
name: IsLocallyConstant
docString: A function between topological spaces is locally constant if the preimage of any set is open.

If a function between topological spaces is locally constant, then it is continuous.

type:
∀ {X : Type u_1} {Y : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace X] [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace Y] {f : X → Y},
  IsLocallyConstant f → Continuous f
name: IsLocallyConstant.continuous
docString: If a function between topological spaces is locally constant, then it is continuous.

This theorem states that for any function `f` from a topological space `X` to another topological space `Y` (where `Y` has a discrete topology), `f` is locally constant if and only if `f` is a continuous function. In other words, a function between topological spaces is locally constant (i.e., the preimage of any set is open) if and only if it is continuous, given that the codomain has a discrete topology.

type:
∀ {X : Type u_1} {Y : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace X] {x : TopologicalSpace Y} [inst_1 : DiscreteTopology Y]
  (f : X → Y), IsLocallyConstant f ↔ Continuous f
name: IsLocallyConstant.iff_continuous
docString: This theorem states that for any function `f` from a topological space `X` to another topological space `Y` (where `Y` has a discrete topology), `f` is locally constant if and only if `f` is a continuous function. In other words, a function between topological spaces is locally constant (i.e., the preimage of any set is open) if and only if it is continuous, given that the codomain has a discrete topology.

A function between topological spaces is continuous on a subset `s`
when it's continuous at every point of `s` within `s`.

type: {X : Type u_1} → {Y : Type u_2} → [inst : TopologicalSpace X] → [inst : TopologicalSpace Y] → (X → Y) → Set X → Prop
name: ContinuousOn
docString:
A function between topological spaces is continuous on a subset `s`
when it's continuous at every point of `s` within `s`.

A function between two topological spaces is continuous if and only if it maps every open set to an open set.

type:
∀ {X : Type u_1} {Y : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace X] [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace Y] {f : X → Y},
  Continuous f ↔ ∀ (x : X), ContinuousAt f x
name: continuous_iff_continuousAt
docString: A function between two topological spaces is continuous if and only if it maps every open set to an open set.

This theorem states that for any types `α` and `β` which have topological space structures, any set `s` of the type `α`, and any element `c` of the type `β`, the function that maps every element of `s` to `c` is continuous on `s`. In other words, a constant function is always continuous on any set within the corresponding topological spaces.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} {β : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace α] [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace β] {s : Set α} {c : β},
  ContinuousOn (fun x => c) s
name: continuousOn_const
docString: This theorem states that for any types `α` and `β` which have topological space structures, any set `s` of the type `α`, and any element `c` of the type `β`, the function that maps every element of `s` to `c` is continuous on `s`. In other words, a constant function is always continuous on any set within the corresponding topological spaces.

If a function is continuous on a set for some topologies, then it is
continuous on the same set with respect to any coarser topology on the target space.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_5} {β : Type u_6} {t₁ : TopologicalSpace α} {t₂ t₃ : TopologicalSpace β},
  t₂ ≤ t₃ → ∀ {s : Set α} {f : α → β}, ContinuousOn f s → ContinuousOn f s
name: ContinuousOn.mono_rng
docString:
If a function is continuous on a set for some topologies, then it is
continuous on the same set with respect to any coarser topology on the target space.

A function between topological spaces is sequentially continuous if it commutes with limit of
convergent sequences.

type: {X : Type u_1} → {Y : Type u_2} → [inst : TopologicalSpace X] → [inst : TopologicalSpace Y] → (X → Y) → Prop
name: SeqContinuous
docString:
A function between topological spaces is sequentially continuous if it commutes with limit of
convergent sequences.

A function to a discrete topological space is continuous if and only if the preimage of every
singleton is open.

type:
∀ {β : Type u_2} {α : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace α] [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace β] [inst_2 : DiscreteTopology β]
  {f : α → β}, Continuous f ↔ ∀ (b : β), IsOpen (f ⁻¹' {b})
name: continuous_discrete_rng
docString:
A function to a discrete topological space is continuous if and only if the preimage of every
singleton is open.

A function between topological spaces is continuous at a point `x₀`
if `f x` tends to `f x₀` when `x` tends to `x₀`.

type: {X : Type u_1} → {Y : Type u_2} → [inst : TopologicalSpace X] → [inst : TopologicalSpace Y] → (X → Y) → X → Prop
name: ContinuousAt
docString:
A function between topological spaces is continuous at a point `x₀`
if `f x` tends to `f x₀` when `x` tends to `x₀`.

function between topological spaces

type: {α : Type u_6} → {β : Type u_7} → [inst : TopologicalSpace α] → [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace β] → SpectralMap α β → α → β
name: SpectralMap.toFun
docString: function between topological spaces

If a function is continuous on a set for some topologies, then it is
continuous on the same set with respect to any finer topology on the source space.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_5} {β : Type u_6} {t₁ t₂ : TopologicalSpace α} {t₃ : TopologicalSpace β},
  t₂ ≤ t₁ → ∀ {s : Set α} {f : α → β}, ContinuousOn f s → ContinuousOn f s
name: ContinuousOn.mono_dom
docString:
If a function is continuous on a set for some topologies, then it is
continuous on the same set with respect to any finer topology on the source space.

The category of topological spaces and continuous maps.

type: Type (u + 1)
name: TopCat
docString: The category of topological spaces and continuous maps.

A function between topological spaces is spectral if it is continuous and the preimage of
every compact open set is compact open.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_2} {β : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace α] [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace β] {f : α → β},
  IsSpectralMap f → ∀ ⦃s : Set β⦄, IsOpen s → IsCompact s → IsCompact (f ⁻¹' s)
name: IsSpectralMap.isCompact_preimage_of_isOpen
docString:
A function between topological spaces is spectral if it is continuous and the preimage of
every compact open set is compact open.

A function between topological spaces is continuous at a point `x₀` within a subset `s`
if `f x` tends to `f x₀` when `x` tends to `x₀` while staying within `s`.

type: {X : Type u_1} → {Y : Type u_2} → [inst : TopologicalSpace X] → [inst : TopologicalSpace Y] → (X → Y) → Set X → X → Prop
name: ContinuousWithinAt
docString:
A function between topological spaces is continuous at a point `x₀` within a subset `s`
if `f x` tends to `f x₀` when `x` tends to `x₀` while staying within `s`.

Every `R`-linear map between two topological `R`-modules, where the source has the module
topology, is continuous.

type:
∀ {R : Type u_1} [τR : TopologicalSpace R] [inst : Semiring R] {A : Type u_2} [inst_1 : AddCommMonoid A]
  [inst_2 : Module R A] [aA : TopologicalSpace A] [inst_3 : IsModuleTopology R A] {B : Type u_3}
  [inst_4 : AddCommMonoid B] [inst_5 : Module R B] [aB : TopologicalSpace B] [inst_6 : ContinuousAdd B]
  [inst_7 : ContinuousSMul R B] (φ : A →+[R] B), Continuous ⇑φ
name: IsModuleTopology.continuous_of_distribMulActionHom
docString:
Every `R`-linear map between two topological `R`-modules, where the source has the module
topology, is continuous.

Any topological space is homotopy equivalent to itself.

type: (X : Type u) → [inst : TopologicalSpace X] → ContinuousMap.HomotopyEquiv X X
name: ContinuousMap.HomotopyEquiv.refl
docString: Any topological space is homotopy equivalent to itself.

Finite topological spaces are compact.

type: ∀ {X : Type u} [inst : TopologicalSpace X] [inst_1 : Finite X], CompactSpace X
name: Finite.compactSpace
docString: Finite topological spaces are compact.

Every `Ctop` is a topological space.

type: {α : Type u_1} → {σ : Type u_3} → Ctop α σ → TopologicalSpace α
name: Ctop.toTopsp
docString: Every `Ctop` is a topological space.

An equiv between topological spaces respecting openness is a homeomorphism.

type:
{X : Type u_1} →
  {Y : Type u_2} →
    [inst : TopologicalSpace X] →
      [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace Y] → (e : X ≃ Y) → (∀ (s : Set Y), IsOpen (⇑e ⁻¹' s) ↔ IsOpen s) → X ≃ₜ Y
name: Equiv.toHomeomorph
docString: An equiv between topological spaces respecting openness is a homeomorphism.

Given two closed sets covering a topological space, and locally constant maps on these two sets,
then if these two locally constant maps agree on the intersection, we get a piecewise defined
locally constant map on the whole space.

TODO: Generalise this construction to `ContinuousMap`.

type:
{X : Type u_1} →
  {Z : Type u_3} →
    [inst : TopologicalSpace X] →
      {C₁ C₂ : Set X} →
        IsClosed C₁ →
          IsClosed C₂ →
            C₁ ∪ C₂ = Set.univ →
              (f : LocallyConstant (↑C₁) Z) →
                (g : LocallyConstant (↑C₂) Z) →
                  (∀ (x : X) (hx : x ∈ C₁ ∩ C₂), f ⟨x, ⋯⟩ = g ⟨x, ⋯⟩) →
                    [inst_1 : DecidablePred fun x => x ∈ C₁] → LocallyConstant X Z
name: LocallyConstant.piecewise
docString:
Given two closed sets covering a topological space, and locally constant maps on these two sets,
then if these two locally constant maps agree on the intersection, we get a piecewise defined
locally constant map on the whole space.

TODO: Generalise this construction to `ContinuousMap`.

An inducing equiv between topological spaces is a homeomorphism.

type:
{X : Type u_1} →
  {Y : Type u_2} →
    [inst : TopologicalSpace X] → [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace Y] → (f : X ≃ Y) → Topology.IsInducing ⇑f → X ≃ₜ Y
name: Equiv.toHomeomorphOfIsInducing
docString: An inducing equiv between topological spaces is a homeomorphism.

If the codomain of a topological embedding is a Hausdorff space, then so is its domain.
See also `T2Space.of_continuous_injective`.

type:
∀ {X : Type u_1} {Y : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace X] [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace Y] [inst_2 : T2Space Y]
  {f : X → Y}, Topology.IsEmbedding f → T2Space X
name: Topology.IsEmbedding.t2Space
docString:
If the codomain of a topological embedding is a Hausdorff space, then so is its domain.
See also `T2Space.of_continuous_injective`.

Any two points in a path-connected space must be joined by a continuous path.

type: ∀ {X : Type u_4} {inst : TopologicalSpace X} [self : PathConnectedSpace X] (x y : X), Joined x y
name: PathConnectedSpace.joined
docString: Any two points in a path-connected space must be joined by a continuous path.
